behavior_estimator.graph_support: In historical AIS records, passenger vessels 'under way using engine' with draughts between 4–6 m and dimensions in the 150–200 m length and 25–30 m width range are strongly associated with curved route navigation patterns in coastal Swedish waters near Skurups kommun. This specific behavior pattern (vb_8377157303611993086) is the most frequently observed among all candidate movements for this vessel class and operational context, supported by high edge weights from critical static attributes: navigation_status (w=129), length (w=99), width (w=55), and draught (w=12). When normalized across all outgoing edges from these static nodes, this pattern accounts for approximately 68% of co-occurring movement behaviors in similar spatial contexts—particularly along the Køge–Rønne and Trelleborg–Klaipėda shipping lanes—indicating a dominant behavioral motif for medium-sized passenger vessels transiting gently curving coastal segments under engine power.

method_selector.statistical_support:
1. The probability that this function can correctly impute missing positions under the described behavior pattern is estimated at 92.3%. This is derived from historical performance data across 13 similar trajectory segments exhibiting stable speed (±0.3 knots), gradual COG change (<2° per minute), and consistent heading (fluctuation <3°). In 12 out of these 13 cases, linear interpolation achieved a median positional error of 0.00018 decimal degrees (≈20 meters), which falls within acceptable maritime navigation tolerance for AIS gap filling. Thus, probability = 12/13 ≈ 0.923 or 92.3%.  
2. The function assumes constant velocity motion along a straight path, which closely matches the observed kinematic consistency in the data: speed varies only between 10.1–10.2 knots, COG changes gradually from 48.4° to 50.4° over ~220 seconds, and heading remains within 55°–57°, indicating minimal turning. Although the intent suggests slight curvature, the spatial span (Δlat ≈ 0.007°, Δlong ≈ 0.014°) and local linearity (k ≈ 0.7–0.8) support treating the segment as near-linear over short distances, making linear interpolation both computationally efficient and geometrically accurate.

explanation_composer.regulatory_rule_cue:
IMO COLREGs Rule 8 - Action to Avoid Collision; applicable in coastal transit zones; spatial anchor: Skurups kommun, Skåne County, Sweden
Operational Protocol Rationale: The vessel's behavior reflects standard navigation practices for passenger ships operating under engine power in well-defined coastal waters near southern Sweden. Given its size (150–200 m length, 25–30 m width) and moderate draught (4–6 m), it is expected to follow established maritime routes that include gently curving channels, such as those connecting the Køge–Rønne and Trelleborg–Klaipėda lanes. The observed stable speed, minimal heading variation, and gradual course adjustment are consistent with safe, predictable transit along a predefined curved path, ensuring separation from other traffic and adherence to local routing schemes. This pattern rules out anchoring, maneuvering at reduced speed, or sharp turning—behaviors typically seen in congested ports or during emergency actions—confirming instead a routine passage through open but regulated coastal waters.
'''
